title: Ticket #4142: Document the CONDOR_ID environment variable
description:
Jobs running in the scheduler universe get an environment variable "CONDOR_ID" which contains the clusterID of the instance. I found this by experiment and by looking at source; however it is undocumented (CONDOR_IDS is an unrelated setting). It appears to be there for the benefit of Pegasus and possibly other similar tools.

It can be useful to know the cluster ID of the condor_dagman job while it is running. For example, if you are keeping track of DAG submissions in an external database, a FINAL node or a SUBDAG EXTERNAL SCRIPT POST can update the database row with the DAG result, using CONDOR_ID to locate the row to update.

I am suggesting that this feature be documented so that it can be used and relied upon.

Discussion at https://lists.cs.wisc.edu/archive/htcondor-users/2013-December/msg00130.shtml
